item.title: The Brain ‘Rotates’ Memories to Save Them From New Sensations

item.title: Lessons on Variable Naming from Breakfast Burritos
item.description: This morning I ordered a breakfast burrito from a local taco shop. Normally this would not be news and obviously would not warrant a blog post or any in-depth analysis, but it was early and I hadn't yet had coffee, so my mind was loose and my thoughts wandering. As I looked over the menu, I pondered the two vegetarian breakfast burrito options:
item.author: (by Brian Schrader)

item.author: (Engineer, Mom, Cook, Musician)

item.title: Misinformation about Permissions Policy and FLoC
item.description: Recently, people have been telling webmasters to add a Permissions-Policy header to their sites to opt out of FLoC; these people don't seem to understand how the Permissions-Policy header works.

item.title: 7 years of open-source database development: lessons learned - Vallified
item.description: It was April 9th 2016, and I tagged my first official release of rqlite — two years after I actually started coding it. Since then there has been 58 releases, 277 closed issues, 416 closed pull requests, 32,785 insertions, 1954 deletions, and 100 files have changed. What is rqlite? rqlite is a lightweight, open-source, distributed … Continue reading 7 years of open-source database development: lessons learned →

item.title: 5G: The outsourced elephant in the room - Articles
item.description: In a break from the usual GPS/Galileo, DNA and C++ posts, here is a bit on 5G and national security. It turns out that through PowerDNS and its parent company Open-Xchange, we know a lot about how large scale European communication service providers work - most of whom are our customers in some way. In addition, in a previous life I worked in national security and because of that I have relevant knowledge of how governments (your own and foreign ones) “interact” with telecommunication providers.

item.title: Content-aware image resizing in JavaScript | Trekhleb
item.description: JavaScript implementation of so-called Seam Carving algorithm for the content-aware image resizing and objects removal. Dynamic programming approach is applied to optimize the resizing time.
